image.altText: Ben Griscti of the Adelaide 36ers warms up by shooting the basketball

props.synopsis: Adelaide 36ers player Ben Griscti has been injured during a training session after a backboard collapsed on top of him.

title.children: NBL player injured when backboard collapses on him following dunk

image.altText: A man in a cap and jacket stands in front of black stud inside a barn

props.synopsis: Farmers have turned out in droves to compete at South Australia's largest agricultural event after a challenging year facing drought conditions.

title.children: Families and farmers flock to SA's largest carnival and agricultural show

image.altText: a young woman leans against a wall staring at the camera with a somber expression

props.synopsis: From poorly categorised NDIS support to high rates of suicide, Tourette syndrome advocates say it's the last disability where "it's still acceptable for people to laugh at".

title.children: 'Loudest in the room ... yet still invisible': Tourette syndrome advocates plead for change

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man diving from a height in front of people watching and boathouses on a river

props.synopsis: The small Victorian town of Nelson has endured tough times over the past five years, but now a small group of friends plans to revive an event that attracted huge crowds up until the 1970s.

title.children: Can this historic regatta coax tourists back to struggling river town?

image.altText: Anne Hatchard of the Crows tackles Tarni Evans of the Giants

props.synopsis: A first-quarter surge with a strong breeze has powered Adelaide to a comfortable 32-point away win over winless GWS.

title.children: Crows breeze to comfortable AFLW win over young Giants

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and hat in a bus filled with glassware cabinets.

props.synopsis: At 33, house painter Jeff Morgan broke his hand and suffered a strange injury that unravelled his life. It was at the kitchen table, where his children were painting with watercolours, that he found his calling.

title.children: House painter turned 'kaleidoscope bus' artist finds his calling

image.altText: A tree with its branches down on the ground at Henley Beach

props.synopsis: Destructive winds sweeping across South Australia have damaged roofs, fences and caused power outages, with the BOM recording two "likely" tornadoes in Adelaide's northern suburbs.

title.children: Two small and fast-moving tornadoes 'likely' hit Adelaide's northern suburbs

image.altText: An aerial image of sheep and a tractor in a dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces an additional $1 billion for farm drought loans and commits to continuing the scheme beyond 2026.

title.children: Drought assistance extended with $1b for Victorian, SA farmers

image.altText: Close-up of a man with a bruised and puffy face with tubes in his nose

props.synopsis: Many AFL players look forward to going back to playing the sport for fun after they leave the professional league. But it's not always a warm welcome back into the lower leagues.

title.children: 'I can't stand you': Ex-AFL players targeted in lower leagues

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: The brother of a man murdered by his landlord in 2021 has told the man responsible he had taken "the heart and soul of a family" and could not "unsee" the harrowing footage of the victim's final moments.

title.children: 'How could you possibly do this to our family?' Impact statements read to landlord who murdered man

image.altText: A white woman wearing a white top and blue jeans raises her hands and sings on stage

props.synopsis: A remote kids choir and a large outback music festival are keen to continue their partnership after successful performances in far west New South Wales.

title.children: Outback students singing at Mundi Mundi Bash a 'heart-melting' moment

image.altText: Three men and two women sitting at a long white desk

props.synopsis: Two energy companies that were set to benefit from a more than $5 billion desalination plant and water pipeline have pulled out, prompting questions over the project's final cost and feasibility.

title.children: Private backers exit from SA’s $5 billion Northern Water project

image.altText: A stone building with large columns

props.synopsis: A disability carer who killed her client in a crash south of Adelaide when she "lost control" and mistakenly hit the accelerator instead of a brake has been spared an immediate jail term.

title.children: Disability carer sentenced for killing client in 'terrible accident'

image.altText: A man in a suit walks out of a court building with glass doors

props.synopsis: Political experts, politicians and the public say a by-election should be held in the state seat of Mount Gambier ahead of the South Australian state election in seven months to make sure the city is represented in parliament.

title.children: Guilty South Australian MP's exit set to spark by-election

image.altText: a man eating and smiling at a dinner table with three other people

props.synopsis: The shock expulsion of the Iranian ambassador to Australia has caused a ripple effect through three different communities here, with many fearful of Tehran's power on foreign soil.

title.children: How cutting diplomatic ties with Tehran has affected Australia's Iranian community

image.altText: Three children, their mum and dad and their grandparents wave while standing on a balcony.

props.synopsis: King Charles hasn't moved into Buckingham Palace and Prince William reportedly plans to live somewhere else as king. So what's wrong with Buckingham Palace and what will its future be if it's not the main residence of the royal family?

title.children: Does Prince William's change of house reflect a new vision for the royal family?

image.altText: A composite image of a hand holding a phone with a green screen and a purple cartoon teacup. Women are on either side of phone.

props.synopsis: Experts have raised concerns that women-only app Tea deepens gender divides and fosters a culture of surveillance and mistrust.

title.children: Why is the second-most-popular app in the US controversial?

image.altText: A woman smiling to camera.

props.synopsis: The upcoming March for Australia has drawn mixed reactions among migrants, with some fearful of anti-immigration sentiment, while others say they are not concerned.

title.children: Nationwide March for Australia sparks mixed reactions among migrants

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking.

props.synopsis: But the US president says the ruling is "incorrect", and is indicating taking the case to the Supreme Court.

title.children: Most of Donald Trump's tariffs illegal, US court rules

image.altText: A bespectcled woman with short hair looks off camera as she poses for a headshot.

props.synopsis: Intentionally attacking civilians like aid and rescue workers, and journalists, is a violation of international humanitarian law and a war crime.

title.children: Journalist who won the prize Trump wants says US democracy 'on the edge of a cliff'

image.altText: A line of damaged buildings.

props.synopsis: These days, sirens and explosions are pretty much the only things that punctuate the silence in Kramatorsk, near Ukraine's front lines. They're a regular reminder of how Russia's military is closing in.

title.children: This city is among Putin's prizes, and 'only stupid people aren't scared'

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Fifty years ago today, Australia's longest running science program was born. Robyn Williams picks some of his favourite stories from his time behind the mic.

title.children: 50 years of wonder and discovery: We celebrate the Science Show

image.altText: A trampoline on the roof of a house.

props.synopsis: The SES says it received more than 1,400 requests for assistance in the past 24 hours, and that Victorians driving on the roads today should expect to see trees down.

title.children: Trees down, damage, outages in Victoria after night of wind, rain, snow

image.altText: roblox child

props.synopsis: If you have kids who game you won't want to know, but will need to hear, that "paedophile hunting" is a booming genre of social media content.

title.children: Why Roblox banned a prominent paedophile hunter

image.altText: East Arnhem Live crowd

props.synopsis: This weekend marks the fourth East Arnhem Land community music festival, with the line-up featuring 10 bands from across the region.

title.children: The music festival 700km down a dirt track in East Arnhem Land

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit with purple tie sitting in parliament

props.synopsis: Labor's strongest governments have often involved vibrant backbenches that took seriously the task of keeping the cabinet on its toes.

title.children: What's the point of all these Labor parliamentarians?

image.altText: The exterior of the Alice Springs courthouse, with blue sky in the background.

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old Indigenous woman who died after being hit by a car following a violent attack by her partner was failed by police multiple times in the lead-up to her death, the Northern Territory coroner has heard during a week-long inquest.

title.children: Police overlooked warnings before woman's DV-related death, inquest hears

image.altText: Runners cross the Sydney Harbour Bridge as part of the Sydney Marathon 2024

props.synopsis: Police officers will be out in full force in Sydney's CBD as 35,000 runners are expected at the Sydney Marathon, and thousands of protesters at three separate rallies.

title.children: Marathon and three protests: Sydneysiders warned of major disruptions on Sunday

image.altText: Former Vice President Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: The president's former rival is due to go on tour to promote her book on her failed campaign called 107 Days.

title.children: Donald Trump cancels Kamala Harris's Secret Service protection

image.altText: Oscar Piastri in the pits at Zandvoort as mechanics tend to the car

props.synopsis: Formula 1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri has avoided a grid penalty after he collided with Mercedes driver George Russell in the pit lane during practice in the Netherlands.

title.children: Piastri avoids penalty after pit lane crash during F1 practice

image.altText: Green tinted photo of woman in vintage car with man in t-shirt and shorts holding a microphone above the car.

props.synopsis: When Disney came to Australia to film Ride a Wild Pony in the 1970s, the crew nearly returned to America to complete filming — then they found Chiltern.

title.children: How an 'unspoilt' Aussie town set the scene for a hidden gem Disney film

image.altText: A man in a black puffer jacket leaves court while pretending to be on a phone call

props.synopsis: A Melbourne lawyer ripped off his victim to the tune of $482,000 with a scheme that included grandiose promises, fake court cases and fabricated legal documents.

title.children: 'Pitiful' Melbourne lawyer caught stealing from grieving widow

image.altText: A woman in a hijab sits in front of a press vest

props.synopsis: Israel has killed 240 Palestinian journalists, according to a local union. Those still standing say "no one is safe".

title.children: Nour is one of Gaza's surviving journalists. She feels like she's in a 'queue to death'

image.altText: A close up shot of police tape with cars parked on a street and trees blurred in the background

props.synopsis: A motorcycle rider has died and a toddler is in a serious condition after separate crashes within an hour of each other on WA roads yesterday.

title.children: Motorcycle rider killed, child seriously hurt on WA roads

image.altText: A composite of pictures of a dinosaur, a man and a woman embracing, and a table of food.

props.synopsis: We've collected the best, most ear-catching quotes of the week. See if you can work out who said what.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: A show-off dinosaur, a chocolate ghosting and a record store singalong
